intro: Gymnosporia rudatisii, commonly known as the roughleaf burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, spiny leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, woody fruits containing seeds. Gymnosporia rudatisii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
